intro: Hyperbaena graciliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered hyperbaena, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly in regions such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
